brief_summary.textblock:
Cluster randomized controlled trial comparing care coordination incentives to pay for
      performance (quality measure) incentives in clinics on utilization, cost, quality, and
      patient experience.

clinical_study.brief_title: Enhancing Complex Care Through an Integrated Care Coordination Information System

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Six Clinics participating whom Care Management Plus team has worked with before

          -  Patients belonging to one of these six clinics

          -  Picked based on an algorithm designed to identify high risk patients.

          -  Clinic will review potential patients list and issue a survey with consent form

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Younger than 18

          -  Older than 90

intervention.description: Research involving materials (data, documents, records, or specimens) that have been collected, or will be collected, solely for non-research purposes (such as medical treatment or diagnosis).
Research involving materials (data, documents, records, or specimens) that have been collected, or will be collected, solely for non-research purposes (such as medical treatment or diagnosis).

clinical_study.official_title: Ambulatory Safety and Quality Program: Improving Management of Individuals With Complex Healthcare Needs Through Health It

primary_outcome.description: Utilization includes Emergency Department visits and hospitalizations for this high risk group.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Patient Assessment of Care for Chronic Conditions (PACIC; Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems
Costs will be aggregated and compared across groups
5 pre-validated quality measures will be aggregated and compared across groups.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
